docs.snippet: A Nashville paper of the 2d says, heavy rains have carried away the bridges on the East Tennessee Railraid, and delayed trains from Richmond three days. A Bowling Green correspondent of the Nashville Union and American says. BUCKNER is advancing...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Nashville paper of the 2d says, heavy rains have carried away the bridges on the East Tennessee Railraid, and delayed trains from Richmond three days. A Bowling Green correspondent of the Nashville Union and American says. BUCKNER is advancing toward the Ohio River, driving the Home Guards before him.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM FORT MONROE.; WOUNDED NATIONAL PRISONERS FROM RICHMOND.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Express met by agreement this morning the rebel steamer Northumberland, with a flag of truce, 12 miles above Newport's News, and brought down 57 wounded prisoners, who were released yesterday at Richmond, and who were taken at the Bull Run battle.
